[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [Connection limits] Are there limits on concurrent connections - can an attacker open many connections to exhaust file descriptors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [CORS headers] Are CORS headers set - can malicious websites make requests to the inspection service from user browsers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [TLS/encryption] The service appears to use HTTP without TLS - can attackers intercept sensitive data in transit? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [Request logging] Are requests logged with IP addresses - can this be used to correlate validator identities with IP addresses? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [Error pages] Do error responses leak stack traces, file paths, or other internal details? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Architecture] [HTTP version] Which HTTP version is used - can HTTP/1.1 pipelining or HTTP/2 multiplexing be abused? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/configuration.rs] [Configuration] [Default settings] What are the default values for expose_configuration, expose_peer_information, etc. - are they secure by default? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/configuration.rs] [Configuration] [Config reload] Can node configuration be reloaded at runtime - is there a race condition between reading expose_* flags and actually exposing data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/configuration.rs] [Configuration] [Flag bypass] Can an attacker modify the expose_* flags through other APIs or configuration endpoints? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Concurrency] [Peers and metadata access] PeersAndMetadata is accessed through Arc without explicit locking - can concurrent modifications cause inconsistent reads? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Concurrency] [Peer list iteration] The function iterates over all peers which may be changing - can peer additions/removals during iteration cause panics or data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/metrics.rs] [Concurrency] [Metric gathering] Multiple threads may call get_all_metrics concurrently - can this cause race conditions in metric collection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/mod.rs] [Concurrency] [NodeConfig cloning] NodeConfig is cloned for each request - if the config is being updated, can this cause inconsistent views? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Memory] [String accumulation] Large Vec<String> is built and joined - can this cause memory fragmentation or allocation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/utils.rs] [Memory] [Metric families cloning] get_metric_families may return large data structures - are they efficiently handled or do they cause memory spikes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/json_encoder.rs] [Memory] [HashMap allocation] A new HashMap is allocated for all metrics - with high cardinality, can this cause OOM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/inspection_client.rs] [Validation] [URL scheme validation] Is the URL scheme validated to be http/https - can file://, ftp://, or other schemes cause SSRF? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/inspection_client.rs] [Validation] [Metric name validation] Metric names from the server are used as-is - can malicious names cause issues in downstream processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Validation] [Peer ID validation] Peer IDs are formatted using {:?} - can malicious peer IDs with control characters break output formatting? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/metrics.rs] [Info leak] [Gauge value semantics] What does consensus_executing_gauge=1 vs 0 reveal about validator behavior - can this be used for timing attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Info leak] [Peer scoring] Exposing peer scores reveals how the node prioritizes peers - can attackers use this to manipulate peer selection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [Info leak] [Request/response counts] Exposing sent_requests_by_type and received_responses_by_type reveals communication patterns - can this enable traffic analysis attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/system_information.rs] [Info leak] [Build timestamp] Exposing exact build time reveals when the validator software was compiled - can this reveal coordinated upgrades? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/peer_information.rs] [DoS] [O(nÂ²) complexity] Multiple sorts and iterations over peer lists - with thousands of peers, what is the time complexity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-inspection-service/src/server/utils.rs] [DoS] [Metric gathering overhead] get_metric_families iterates all metrics - can an attacker register many metrics to slow down gathering? (Medium)
